is a small city in Central
. The area surrounding it saw some of the fiercest fighting during the American War. Khe Sanh marine base features one of the best museums in the DMZ area.
Mini buses depart Dong Ha for the border frequently stopping at Khe Sanh on request.

value: , Easily the best preserved of the DMZ bases there is a good museum featuring many photos from the war. The old airstrip still remains and several American helicopters, a C130 transport and some North Vietnamese tanks. Turn off highway 9 at the large memorial near the entrance to town onto the Ho Chi Minh Highway, follow the road for around 3 kilometers there is a large blue sign on the right hand side.
There are many located throughout the town
Located in the special economic zone bordering Laos the market is far bigger than it would be otherwise for a town of its size, and with few tourists prices are cheap.
Head to stalls at the lower end of the market a rice dish with all the fixings for around 20,000 dong.
Comfortable, clean and friendly hotel located on highway 9. Rooms come with fan, A/C,fridge, tv and hot shower. 200,000 dong
